title: A Study of reward and punishment in Charles Dickens' Nicholas Nichleby
abstract: The thesis writer studies the reward and punishment in Nicholas Nickleby because Charles Dickens is a remarkable novelist whose writings are mostly about justice for everyone.This study is about Charles Dickens idea of reward and punishment that becomes a major theme in most of Dickens novels.The thesis writer,therefore,is curious to know how the theme of reward and punishment is reflected through the characters in Charles Dickens novel Nicholas Nickleby . The analysis shows that at the beginning of the novel, Ralph stands for evil;Nicholas and Kate stand for good. Ralph does the bad ways to Nicholas,Kate,and his clerk in order to get many advantages.However,Nicholas and Kate are always good to Ralph and his son,their mother, and everybody.From the analysis,the thesis writer concludes that Ralph who is evil to his nephew,niece, and clerk gets punishment.Ralph commits suicide by hanging himself.He punishes himself.On the other hand,Nicholas and Kate Nickleby who are helpful,kind and compassionate to everybody,get reward.Nicholas marries a rich woman and Kate marries a rich man.They live happily ever after.
contributors: Julia Eka Rini (Advisor 1); Jenny Mochtar Djundjung (Examination Committee 1)
